question: A 55-year-old male presented to the clinic with the complaint of fever, weight loss, and back pain. On physical examination, extreme tenderness was noticed at the lumbar vertebrae. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the lumbar spine showed evidence of Pott’s disease. Which of the following organisms is most commonly involved in this disease process?

A 58-year-old woman discussed osteoporosis with her physician. She was worried that for a couple of years, after menopause, she was at an increased risk for osteoporosis. Which of the following is prescribed initially to prevent the risk of future problems?

answers.option: Maintaining adequate calcium and vitamin D through diet modification and/or supplementation
Infusion of potent bisphosphonates at large intervals

question: Which of the following can be caused by inhalation of coal dust?
Which of the following is a reliable and the most common method used for disinfection of water?
A young male presents with migratory joint pain for the last 1 week. In addition, he has had diarrhea for a week. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy is brought into the emergency department after falling from his bike. He is found to have an undisplaced fracture of the middle third of the clavicle. What is the best course of management in this situation?
Which of the following is a common early complication of a supracondylar fracture of the humerus?

A 64-year-old woman is brought into the emergency department with the complaint of severe lower back pain after she suffered a fall while walking outside her house. Physical examination reveals kyphosis and height loss. Which of the following radiological investigations is the most appropriate first choice to establish a diagnosis of the underlying disorder?
Which occupational lung disease is caused by exposure to sugar cane dust?

A 55-year-old female, para 11+2, presents to the outpatient clinic with bilateral knee and back pain for the past 6 months. The doctor recommends an investigation for determining the bone mineral density. What is the investigation of choice?

An osteoarthritis patient was given non-pharmacological treatment which did not improve their condition. What is the next step in management?
During a 1000m race, a kid collapses during the final part of the race and is rushed to the hospital for treatment. What is the most probable cause of this kid's collapse?

A 22-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of bone pain and a mass around the knee that is increasing in size very rapidly. The biopsy of the mass shows bone formation by tumor cells. Which of the following organs is most likely to be affected first?
A 40-year-old lady taking methotrexate for rheumatoid arthritis complains of nausea and vomiting for the last 2 weeks. What should be the appropriate measure to reduce these side effects?
Which of the following drugs can be given in acute gout?
Which of the following drugs is effective in managing acute gouty arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and also accelerates closure of patent ductus arteriosus in premature infants?
Osteomyelitis is most commonly a bacterial infection that arises via hematogenous spread. Which of the following organisms is the most common cause of this disease?
Which type of lower limb orthosis is typically prescribed in club foot?

A 55-year-old female has been brought to the emergency room following severe lower back pain following a fall from standing height in the bathroom. A radiograph reveals fracture of the neck of femur. General examination reveals kyphosis and height loss. Which of the following investigations is the best choice for confirmation of the underlying disorder?

answers.option: DEXA scan of lumber spine and hip

question: A patient presents with lower back pain and uveitis. His X-ray shows a bamboo-like spine. What disease could he possibly have?

Which score is used in a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DEXA) scan to determine bone mineral density in post-menopausal women?
What is the most common joint involvement in ankylosing spondylitis?
A middle-aged lady presents with acute onset pain in her right thigh. What is the ideal first investigation?
A 7-year-old boy presents with back pain and red-eye for the past 10 days. Past history includes a diarrheal illness preceding the current symptoms of the patient. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of these is the most specific test for rheumatoid arthritis?
In contrast to gout, which of the folowing is the most commonly involved joint in pseudogout?
What is the name for dislodged pieces of cartilage and bone that tumble into the joint space?

A 40-year-old female patient presents with back pain and extreme weight loss. She was diagnosed with breast cancer 5 years ago but she denied chemotherapy or any other form of treatment. What will be the next best investigation?
Which of the following cells are responsible for the formation of the organic component of cartilage?
Where do the mesenchymal cells come from that are involved in forming the pelvic and the pectoral girdle?
Which of the following bone pathologies has a characteristic 'onion peel' appearance?

Which of the following is the most common adverse effect of methotrexate?
Which of these is the most severe side effect of colchicine?
The structure of which of the following drugs do the bisphosphonates most closely resemble?
A 43-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a sprained ankle. She has active peptic ulcers currently. Which of the following COX-2 inhibitors can be safely prescribed to her?

A 55-year-old postmenopausal woman presents to the clinic showing signs of early osteoporosis. Her mother died of breast cancer five years ago. Which of the following medications can prevent fractures as well as reduce the risk of development of breast cancer?

Which of the following gene mutations is associated with seronegative arthropathies?

answers.option: Upper back pain radiating to the shoulder
Lower back pain radiating to the buttocks

question: Which of the following is not a cause of osteoporosis?

Which of the following bone tumors has a 'soap bubble' appearance on X-ray?
A 58-year-old female presents with an inter-trochanteric fracture of the femur. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for her?
An osteoblastic metastasis is most likely to occur from which of the following malignancies?
Which of the following is an advantage of using the imaging modality of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)?

answers.option: Most initial modality to check for bone tumors
Most important modality to diganose bone tumors
Helps in determination of intramedullary extent

question: Which of these metastatic bone tumors shows up as a solitary unifocal lesion?
Which of the following drugs binds to tubulin protein?
A 50-year-old postmenopausal woman comes into the clinic with a leg fracture. She has had an inactive lifestyle her whole life. What is the ideal drug to be prescribed to treat her fracture?
An 8-year-old male child presents with unilateral thigh swelling and a restricted range of motion. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 69-year-old presents to the orthopedic department complaining of severe knee pain. Pain is localized to the anterior region and gets worse when climbing the stairs. On examination, he has tenderness in the joint line, anterior patello-femoral joint crepitus, and varus deformity at the knee joint. There is also a mild to moderate effusion. The doctor suspects osteoarthritis. What should be the next step in his management?
Which of the following refers to the primary role of the parathyroid gland?

answers.option: To send hormonal signals to other endocrine organs
To receive hormonal signals from the hypothalamus

question: Smog most commonly arises in winter areas and is found abundantly in urban areas. It affects the respiratory system of a human due to the presence of which of the following?
Which of the following is the most commonly employed method of disinfection?

A refugee campus at the boundaries of Balochistan has a sudden rise of cases of diarrhea. The medical officer informs the authorities about the outbreak. Which of the following is the immediate step to be taken by the authorities for the water borne diseases?

answers.option: Addition of chlorine to the water supply

question: A 30-year-old male comes to the emergency room with a history of polytrauma after a road traffic accident. He has a mid-shaft right humeral fracture, ipsilateral ulnar, radius, and femoral fractures as well. What is the best treatment option for this patient?

answers.option: Open reduction and internal fixation with broad deep compression plate (DCP)

question: A 57-year-old mechanic presents with increasing left-sided groin pain over the past 4 months. He has no systemic illnesses apart from diabetes mellitus that is well controlled. On examination, he has a Body Mass Index (BMI) of 30 kg/m2. There is reduced passive internal rotation of the hip to about 10 degrees and reduced flexion of up to 50 degrees with pain. X-ray of the pelvis shows left femoral head collapse, reduced joint space, and osteophytes at the superolateral aspect of the acetabulum. What is the most appropriate treatment?
Which section of the manuscript does not have the references?
A 50-year-old lady has a distal radius fracture and it is managed conservatively in the emergency room. What are the criteria for post-reduction X-rays in this type of fracture?

answers.option: Radial shortening <5 mm at the distal radioulnar joint
Intraarticular gap < 10 mm of radiocarpal joint
Articular incongruity of <10 mm of sigmoid notch of distal radius
Intraarticular step off or gap <5 mm of radiocarpal joint

question: A 60-year-old female with left glenohumeral joint osteoarthritis for 3 years presents with joint pain that is not relieved by medication. Examination reveals restricted abduction, internal, and external rotation with mild swelling around the shoulder joint. X-ray reveals reduced joint space in the glenohumeral joint, osteophytes in the acromioclavicular joint. What will be the most appropriate treatment option?

A 20-year-old male presents to the clinic with complaints of localized, dull, aching pain of the right tibia, particularly at night, and is relieved with aspirin. He has no history of trauma. X-ray shows a radiolucent nidus with a rim of reactive bone around the diaphysis of the proximal tibia. What is the most likely benign tumor that causes nocturnal pain in this patient?

A 3.5-year-old boy has a fragile skeleton with a history of repeated fractures. He has short stature, clinical evaluation reveals growth retardation, blue sclera, teeth abnormalities, and impaired hearing. His older sister also has similar complaints. His parents had consanguineous marriage. Which of the following is the best diagnosis?

A 70-year-old lady presents to the outpatient department with complaints of pain in the lower limbs. X-rays showed anterior bowing of both femurs. Histopathological evaluation reveals increased but disordered and structurally unsound bone mass and characteristic mosaic pattern of the lamellar bone. Her mother also had a similar bone pathology what is the most likely disease?

A middle-aged male presents with complaints of bone pain. He has compromised renal function. Laboratory tests show deranged renal function tests along with abnormal mineral metabolism. Histopathological examination shows features of osteoporosis, brown tumors, and osteitis fibrosa cystica. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis in this case?
A 36-year-old lady presents with vaginal bleeding after 2 months of amenorrhea. The gynecologist suspects gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD). Which of the following is not a GTD?
Partial moles result from the fertilization of an egg with TWO sperm. Which of the following is NOT a possible outcome?

A 30-year-old intravenous drug abuser is diagnosed with osteomyelitis of the right tibia. The causative organism is Staphylococcus aureus. What is the most likely antibiotic that would be most effective against this organism?
A 5-year-old boy is given aspirin by a general practitioner to alleviate his pain and fever caused by measles. What problem will this boy suffer due to this medication?

Which of the following drugs is not contraindicated in a patient with hemophilia?

A 16-year-old child comes with his parents to the outpatient department. The parents complain to the doctor that their child has a short stature and has not developed puberty yet. The doctor examines the child and concludes that the bone age is less than the chronological age and diagnoses the child with constitutional growth delay. The parents are worried about the final height of the child. What would be the best treatment for this child?

answers.option: No treatment and the final height is decreased.
Surgery to increase the height of femur

question: The pediatrician examines a child and concludes that the bone age is the same as the chronological age. This is true for which of the following growth disorder?

answers.option: The inhibition of the COX enzyme is reversible
They irreversibly bind to COX enzymes

question: Which of the following statements is true about acetaminophen?

answers.option: It has a strong anti inflammatory activity
It acts both centrally and peripherally
Does not cause gastric mucosa damage
It is not avoided in patients with severe hepatic impairment

question: Which tumor is associated with a translocation of t(11:22)?

answers.option: Giant cell tumour of the bone

question: What is the most common diaphyseal tumor?

answers.option: Giant cell tumour of the bone

question: What is true about the risk factors for Dupuytren's contracture?

answers.option: It is common on the radial side of the hand.
Associated with male, smoking and alcohol

question: Which one of the following is an example of a ball and socket joint?

answers.option: Proper sterilization technique was not used
Mishandling of tissues resulting in disrupted blood supply

question: What is true about clubfoot?

answers.option: Surgical management includes tendon transfer and osteotomies
Hindfoot is equinus and adducted, forefoot is varus and pronated

question: What is true about patellofemoral osteoarthritis?

answers.option: It is usually unilateral in nature
Its also another name for hip osteoarthritis
Usually the pain is posteriorly in the knee
It presents with pain while climbing up the stairs

question: A patient presented in the emergency after a road traffic accident. On examination, the neck veins are distended and the trachea is in the midline. On auscultation, the heart sounds are muffled. What is the most probable diagnosis?

What is the route for the spread of tuberculosis to the spine?
What is true about associations with Lambert-Eaton syndrome?

answers.option: It is associated with small cell lung carcinoma
Antibodies to acetylcholine receptors in the post-junctional membrane of the neuromuscular junction
Resting of the eyelids (looking downwards) may be followed by increased reflex elevation with up-gaze (so-called Cogan’s lid twitch sign)
Worsening of symptoms towards the end of the day or following exercise is characteristic

question: A young gymnast comes to the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of lower back pain. The clinician after taking radiographs concluded that there is a defect in the pars interarticularis. What is this condition called?
What is the cause of caisson's disease?

answers.option: It is characterized by pulmonary insufficiency, neurologic symptoms, anemia, and thrombocytopenia
It is an ominous complication of labor and the immediate postpartum period
Air embolism due to pressure change

question: A man with a history of a fall presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of pain in the lower back. On examination, the power in the lower limbs is 2/5 and the perianal sensation is intact. There is no urinary retention. What is the most probable diagnosis?

What is the usual duration of spinal shock?

Which malignancy is associated with asbestosis?

A patient presents to the outpatient department for the evaluation of his dwarfism. On examination, he has short limbs and a relatively large head. The father also had the same condition. What is your most probable diagnosis?
A patient presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of bone pain and deafness for the past few days. He also complains about increasing hat size. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the most important initial point to assess in the management of spinal injury?

answers.option: Look for second spinal injury at a remote location
Check for sensory loss at different levels

question: Which of the following is false about the treatment of acute osteomyelitis?

answers.option: Take blood sample before starting antibiotics
High dose antibiotics against Staph aureus, Streptococci and gram-negative Bacteria
Prognosis is good in 90% cases with appropriate treatment
Surgery is needed in non-responsive cases

question: A 20-years old male presented to the clinic with history of pain and swelling along medial aspect of right knee. There is no history of trauma. X-ray shows a pedunculated bony outgrowth from metaphysis of distal femur pointing away from the joint. What is most likely pedunculated benign tumor that caused this swelling?

A 30-year-old male was presented in a clinic with a suspected bone tumor epiphysis of the proximal tibia. X-ray shows an eccentric lytic area, giving a "soap bubble" involving appearance. Which of the following benign tumors has a hallmark of a soap bubble appearance?

Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation to diagnose osteomyelitis in early stages?
A 20-year-old female presents with swelling right proximal tibia. X-ray shows a sunburst-appearance osteoblastic lesion in the proximal tibia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the best method of resection in a malignant bone tumor?
Which of the following is considered the diagnostic test for osteoporosis?

A 45-year-old man presented to the emergency department with complaints of back pain that had been present for six months. He reported that the pain was worse when at rest and improved with activity. In addition to the back pain, he complained of redness in his left eye. After an investigation, he was diagnosed with ankylosing spondylitis. Which of the following gene is associated with ankylosing spondylitis?

A 30-year-old man presented to his family physician with complaints of joint pain. He reported that the pain was moderate to severe and that he found relief by taking NSAIDs. Which of the following clinical features would suggest that the patient has seronegative spondyloarthropathies?

answers.option: Inflammatory bowel symptoms precede the joint pain
Small joint involved in majority of cases
Pain and stiffness improves with rest
Low back pain and early morning stiffness with radiation to the buttocks or posterior thighs

question: A scholar was searching for literature relevant to "diabetes mellitus" that was published in Pakistan. To find the desired articles on PubMed, he used the Boolean operator 'AND' between the key terms. Which of the following is the purpose of the 'AND' Boolean operator?
Which of the following is the primary role of the parathyroid gland?

answers.option: To receive hormonal signals from the hypothalamus
To send hormonal signals to other endocrine organs

question: A 62-year-old female is treated with alendronate after a vertebral compression fracture she experienced six months ago. The follow-up quantitative X-ray demonstrates an increase in bone mass when compared to the baseline. The drug used to treat this patient's bone disease is structurally similar to which of the following substances?
Which of the following diseases is caused by inhalation of sugarcane dust?

A 50-year-old woman has had no major medical problems but has not been physically active for most of her life. One day after falling out of bed, she immediately noticed a sharp pain in her right hip. She is subsequently unable to ambulate without severe pain. Radiographs show a fracture of the left femoral head and a compressed fracture of T10. Which of the following conditions is she most likely to have?

A 16-year-old girl is noted to be developing an odd, twisted appearance to her back for the past 3 years. On examination, she is tall and thin. A radiograph reveals an abnormal lateral bowing of the spine, with 20 degrees of lateral curvature in the mid-thoracic region. Which of the following is most likely to produce these findings?

answers.option: Disorder of procollagen synthesis with multiple compressed fractures
Multiple osteochondromas of the vertebral bodies
Repeated episodes of blunt force trauma to the torso
Asymmetric cartilage growth of vertebral body end plates

question: Which of the following statements is true regarding sequestrum formation in the course of osteomyelitis?

answers.option: It is formed as a result of necrosis
It is formed as a result of deposition of new bone
It is formed as a result of destruction of hyaline cartilage
It is formed as a result of apoptosis
It is formed as a result of intraosseous abscess

question: An X-ray pelvis anteroposterior view of a young female demonstrated bilateral symmetrical transverse lucent bands oriented at right angles to the cortex involving the neck of the femur. These lucent lines do not extend across the full width of the femur. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The strength of bone as a tissue depends on which of the following factors?

answers.option: It has amorphous calcium phosphate as its major mineral constituent
It contains more water than cartilage
It contains type-Il collagen in its ground substances
It is largely devoid of cells

question: Mesenchymal cells for the membranous neurocranium are derived from which of the following?

answers.option: Lateral mesoderm and neural crest cells
Paraxial mesoderm and neural crest cells

question: The bones of the pelvic and pectoral girdle are formed from the mesenchyme of which of the following?

A 60-year-old man was brought to the psychiatric outpatient department with complaints of forgetfulness, poor sleep, odd behavior, repeated speech, and inability to recognize his family members sometimes for the last 6 months, however, he remembers all the past events correctly. What is the most likely diagnosis in this person?
